alert.note: Alert for Coastal St. Johns; Eastern Clay; Eastern Marion; Eastern Putnam; Inland Nassau; Inland St. Johns; South Central Duval; Trout River; Western Clay; Western Duval; Western Putnam (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 2:52PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Nassau, St. Johns, northeastern Marion, Putnam, Clay and Duval Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 250 PM EDT, thunderstorms will increase in coverage and intensity as they track northeast around 10 mph across Duval, Clay, Putnam and St. Johns Counties through 4 pm. Intensification is expected as storms encounter the sea breeze and outflows. Brief landspouts and very heavy rainfall are expected as well as minor flooding. Wind gusts near 40 mph have been reported with these storms. HAZARD...Landspouts and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jacksonville, Saint Augustine, Palatka, Orange Park, Green Cove Springs, Crescent City, Interlachen, Keystone Heights, Pomona Park and Hastings. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. For boaters on or near the St Johns River or Intracoastal waterway, move to a safe shelter now! Do not be caught on or near the water. Gusty winds and choppy waves are likely. Make sure all on board are wearing life jackets.
